Analytics Documentation

v0.0.1

Introduction

This control wraps Google Analytics code inclusion and provides script-level dynamic control over the Urchin script.
Test:
Analytics.html (unit tests)

Requirement

  • wednus.js
  • Google Analytics account

Structure

Analytics is a type3 control.

Usage

1. Including

Add following line of code in script block. 
 W.control('Analytics');

2. Instantiate a control object

Now we can create an Analytics object as follow: 
 var myAnalytics = new W.Analytics([acct_no], [isPending], [mode]);
Parameters:
acct_no Google Analytics profile ID (e.g. 'UA-103181-8')
isPending (optional) true for pending tracking. otherwise, auto-start tracking
mode service mode (0=local, 1=remote, 2=both)

3. Using object

After the object creation, now we can access public member properties and methods as below: 
 myAnalytics.start();  // start tracking

Code Example

This example will include Google Analytics code. 
 <script type='text/javascript'>
 W.control('Analytics');
 </script>

 <script type='text/javascript'>
 var myAnalytics = new W.Analytics('UA-103181-8', true);
 myAnalytics.start();

 // or, to start tracking immediatly:
 //var myAnalytics = new W.Analytics('UA-103181-8');
 </script>

Test:
CodeExample.html
Warning:
Do NOT merge script blocks into one because each block is closure.
